title: Print/poster, In honor of Robert H. Goddard, "A method of Reaching Extreme Altitudes", late 20th century
title_raw: In honor of Robert H. Goddard, "A method of Reaching Extreme Altitudes"
signed: Signature imprinted in black along lower right edge (sideways): Design: Edward Fella, Designers & Partners.
inscribed: Imprinted in red ink diagonally from lower edge, center, to right edge, center: Robert H. Goddard, "A Method of Reaching Extreme Altitudes." 1919-Apollo 11, "Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon." July 20, 1969
description: Poster in black and red ink on cream cardstock.  In center is an image of Robert Goddard (inventor of first high altitute rocket) in light gray jacket, dark gray pants.  His skin and tie are red.  He stands in front of a geometrical form resembling a partial rectangular box, formed by a black parallelogram receding right and a white parallelogram receding left.  At the top right corner of the black parallelogram is a white circle and crescent, which are repeated in an open box at the bottom left corner of the parallelogram.  Title and additional text imprinted diagonally in red paralleling the receding black parallelogram.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print/poster, In honor of Robert H. Goddard, "A method of Reaching Extreme Altitudes", late 20th century. Offset lithograph on cream cardstock. 
Gift of Edward Fella. 1995-42-41
